com.camerontec.catalys.server.component

Class ComponentHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractConfigurableSelectorComponent, BreakOutBox, CatalysApplication, DefaultClientConnectionManager, DefaultFlatFileReader, DefaultFlatFileWriter, ExposableMBeanComponent, FileLookupService, FilePasswordStoreWithMemoryBase, FixLoginAuthenticationMonitor, FIXMessageProcessorBase, HAContext, ItchGlimpseReferenceDataProviderBase, JdbcPeerApplicationBase, JmsSharedConsumer, JMXManagementService, MarketDataEntitlementsServiceBase, MarketDataServiceBase, MessageCountsStatsService, OuchFileReferenceDataProviderBase, OuchSessionManagerService, PeerApplicationManager, PeerApplicationManagerService, SampleMonitorCustomizer, SampleService, Scheduler, ServerConnectionManager, SessionOverseer, SessionStatusListenerBase, SharedSocketAdapter, SocketAdapter, SocketAdapterServer, SoupTCPSessionService, StandardServiceLocator, ThreadStackLogger, TIBRVSharedConsumer, WebServerService

    public class ComponentHelper
extends AbstractConfigurable
implements IComponent
    Classes that want to implement the IComponent and the IConfigurable interface can use this base implementation either by subclassing it or delegating the interface methods to an instance of it.

    It is implemented as follows:

    • Attributes are stored in a local Map variable and can be initialized from a Properties constructor. They can be accessed using getAttribute(String).
    • Active status is stored in a local boolean variable.
    • It has no exposed state (getComponentStatus returns null).
    • Components are registered with the ComponentRegistry the first time they are opened, and unregistered when the component is closed.
    • The refreshStateFromAttributes() method is called from openComponent() and configure(com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.IConfiguration).
      • refreshStateFromAttributes should be overridden to refresh the component's local state for all attributes that are permitted to change at runtime.
      • openComponent should be overridden to initialize the component's local state for attributes which are not permitted to change at runtime. If openComponent is overridden then it should call the base ComponentHelper.openComponent method.
    • The remaining methods do nothing and can be overridden by subclasses as needed.

      • logger

        protected volatile ILogger logger
        Default logger for this class and its subclasses.

        The logger name is updated (if appropriate) when this component's attributes are set (see setAttributes(java.util.Map)) to take into consideration the component name.

        Subclasses may override if more convenient.

        Configuration for this component.

    • Method Detail

      • updateLoggerName

        protected void updateLoggerName()
        Update the logger name.

        The default implementation changes the name to represent a particular instance if the properties contains a value for the NAME_KEY.

      • openComponent

        public boolean openComponent()
                      throws Exception
        If the component is already open, this method does nothing. Otherwise it marks the component as open, registers it with the ComponentRegistry and calls refreshStateFromAttributes() to apply the configuration.
        Specified by:
        openComponent in interface IComponent
        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it is unable to properly configure itself.

      • closeComponent

        public boolean closeComponent()
                       throws Exception
        If the component is already closed, this method does nothing. Otherwise it marks the component as closed (ie not open) and unregisters it from the ComponentRegistry
        Specified by:
        closeComponent in interface IComponent
        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it was unable to completely close. It should not throw an exception until it has closed itself as fully as possible.

      • refreshStateFromAttributes

        public void refreshStateFromAttributes()
                                throws Exception
        Instruct the component to reconfigure itself while running. Called by openComponent() and configure(IConfiguration) (if the component was open).

        This base implementation does nothing by default. Override this if your component supports this method.

        Specified by:
        refreshStateFromAttributes in interface IHasAttributes
        Throws:
        Exception - If the refresh failed for any reason.

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Updates component attributes from configuration and calls refreshStateFromAttributes() if open. This method is usually called from the Configuration/JMX thread.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.

      • checkThatStateConformsToConfiguration

        public final boolean checkThatStateConformsToConfiguration(IConfiguration expectedConfiguration)
        Checks that the internal component state conforms to a given configuration. Used primarily by configuration reload tests. This base implementation perform the following checks:
        • If my configuration is null then configure() did not execute properly. Return false.
        • If my configuration is not equal to expected configuration then state is not derived from expected configuration. Return false.
        • Otherwise, delegate to doCheckThatStateConformsToConfiguration(IConfiguration), which should be overridden in subclasses.
        Parameters:
        expectedConfiguration - the expected configuration
        Returns:
        whether or not the component's state matches the specified configuration

      • doCheckThatStateConformsToConfiguration

        protected boolean doCheckThatStateConformsToConfiguration(IConfiguration expectedConfiguration)
        Called from checkThatStateConformsToConfiguration(IConfiguration). This should be overridden in subclasses with component specific logic.
        Parameters:
        expectedConfiguration - the expected configuration
        Returns:
        true

        Returns:

      • getSubComponentAttributes

        protected Map<String,Object> getSubComponentAttributes(String name)
        Get the named subcomponent's attributes, guaranteeing attribute uniqueness between parent and child attributes where appropriate.

        This method is intended to be used by subclasses which contain nested components. In such cases IComponent.NAME_KEY duplication is rarely sought since this results in multiple components being registered with the ComponentRegistry under the same name. Therefore this method is a helper to enforce name uniqueness amongst nested components.

        Parameters:
        name - The subcomponent name.
        Returns:
        The subcomponent attributes, which is a clone of the parent's attributes apart from the unique name.
